t: 1 Chronicles 16
They*p brought the ark of God and placed it inside the tent David had pitched for it. Then they offered burnt offerings and fellowship offerings in God’s presence.
When David had finished offering the burnt offerings and the fellowship offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.*s
Then he distributed to each and every Israelite, both men and women, a loaf of bread, a date cake, and a raisin cake.
David*p appointed some of the Levites to be ministers before the ark of the Lord,*s to celebrate the Lord*s God of Israel, and to give thanks and praise to him.
Asaph was the chief and Zechariah was second to him. Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel played the harps and lyres, while Asaph sounded the cymbals
and the priests Benaiah and Jahaziel blew the trumpets regularly before the ark of the covenant of God.
David’s Psalm of Thanksgiving
On*p that day David decreed for the first time that thanks be given to the Lord*s by Asaph and his relatives:
Give*pn thanks to the Lord;*s call on his name; proclaim*ln his deeds among the peoples.
Sing*ln to him; sing praise to him; tell*ln about all his wondrous works!
Boast*ln in his holy name; let*ln the hearts of those who seek the Lord*s rejoice.
Seek*ln the Lord*s and his strength; seek*ln his face always.
Remember*ln the wondrous works he has done, his*ln wonders, and the judgments he has pronounced,
you*ln offspring of Israel his servant, Jacob’s*ln descendants - his chosen ones.
He*pn is the Lord*s our God; his*ln judgments govern the whole earth.
Remember*ln his covenant forever — the*ln promise he ordained for a thousand generations,
the*ln covenant he made with Abraham, swore*ln to Isaac,
and*ln confirmed to Jacob as a decree, and*ln to Israel as a permanent covenant:
“I*ln will give the land of Canaan to you as*ln your inherited portion.”
When*pn they were few in number, very*ln few indeed, and resident aliens in Canaan
wandering*ln from nation to nation and*ln from one kingdom to another,
he*ln allowed no one to oppress them; he*ln rebuked kings on their behalf:
“Do*ln not touch my anointed ones or*ln harm my prophets.”
Let*pn the whole earth sing to the Lord.*s Proclaim*ln his salvation from day to day.
Declare*ln his glory among the nations, his*ln wondrous works among all peoples.
For*pn the Lord*s is great and highly praised; he*ln is feared above all gods.
For*ln all the gods of the peoples are worthless idols, but*ln the Lord*s made the heavens.
Splendor*ln and majesty are before him; strength*ln and joy are in his place.
Ascribe*ln to the Lord,*s families of the peoples, ascribe*ln to the Lord*s glory and strength.
Ascribe*ln to the Lord*s the glory of his name; bring*ln an offering and come before him. Worship*ln the Lord*s in the splendor of his holiness;
let*ln the whole earth tremble before him. The*ln world is firmly established; it*ln cannot be shaken.
Let*ln the heavens be glad and the earth rejoice, and*ln let them say among the nations, “The Lord*s reigns!”
Let*ln the sea and all that fills it resound; let*ln the fields and everything in them exult.
Then*ln the trees of the forest will shout for joy before the Lord,*s for*ln he is coming to judge the earth.
Give*pn thanks to the Lord,*s for he is good; his*ln faithful love endures forever.
And*ln say, “Save us, God of our salvation; gather*ln us and rescue us from the nations so*ln that we may give thanks to your holy name and*ln rejoice in your praise.
Blessed*ln be the Lord*s God of Israel from*ln everlasting to everlasting.” Then*p all the people said, “Amen” and “Praise the Lord.”*s
So*p David left Asaph and his relatives there before the ark of the Lord’s*s covenant to minister regularly before the ark according to the daily requirements.
He assigned Obed-edom and his sixty-eight relatives. Obed-edom son of Jeduthun and Hosah were to be gatekeepers.
David left the priest Zadok and his fellow priests before the tabernacle of the Lord*s at the high place in Gibeon

to offer burnt offerings regularly, morning and evening, to the Lord*s on the altar of burnt offerings and to do everything that was written in the law of the Lord,*s which he had commanded Israel to keep.
With them were Heman, Jeduthun, and the rest who were chosen and designated by name to give thanks to the Lord-*s for his faithful love endures forever.
Heman and Jeduthun had with them trumpets and cymbals to play and musical instruments of God. Jeduthun’s sons were at the city gate.
Then*p all the people went home, and David returned home to bless his household.
